DOC.criteria: Age old 18 year old admission ICU Acute kidney injury ( define serum creatinine increase ≥ 0.3 mg/dL urine output ≤ 0.5 mL/kg/hour accord KDIGO criterion ) Informed consent provide patient person decisional responsibility Indwelling bladder catheter Documented cause acute kidney injury acute tubular necrosis e.g . presence granular epithelial cast urine sediment , FeNa 1 % , Feurea 50 % , urine plasma neutrophil gelatinaseassociated lipocalin ( NGAL ) 150 mg/dL Opinion treat clinical team patient well resuscitate sufficiently clinically stable intervention noninvasive invasive measurement i.e . fluid accumulation least 5 % plus least one follow e.g . chest radiography , central venous pressure ≥ 8 mmHg , pulse pressure variation < 13 % , inferior vena cava collapsibility index < 50 % spontaneously breathe patient distensibility index < 18 % mechanically ventilated patient Baseline serum creatinine ≥ 2 mg/dL ( male ) ≥ 1.5 mg/dL ( female ) within 3 month Evidence volume depletion time furosemide administration active bleed Evidence obstructive uropathy , renal vein thrombosis renal artery stenosis , thrombotic microangiopathy , glomerulonephritis , tumor lysis syndrome History renal allograft Known pregnancy Allergy know sensitivity loop diuretic Need emergency renal replacement therapy randomization evaluation clinical team renal replacement therapy defer Patient moribund expect death within 24 hr survival 28 day unlikely due uncontrollable comorbidity ( cardiac , pulmonary hepatic endstage disease ; hepatorenal syndrome ; poorly control cancer ; severe postanoxic encephalopathy ; etc . ) Patients advance directive issue express desire resuscitate Prior treatment RRT within 30 day
